metadata.Title: CVE-2019-17565 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - medium.
metadata.Description:
There is a vulnerability in Apache Traffic Server 6.0.0 to 6.2.3, 7.0.0 to 7.1.8, and 8.0.0 to 8.0.5 with a smuggling attack and chunked encoding. Upgrade to versions 7.1.9 and 8.0.6 or later versions.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-17565` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 9.1.3+ds-1
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 9.1.3+ds-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: trafficserver package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '9.1.3+ds-1').
